name: ShipSidenav
description:
### Variants Sidenavs support multiple behaviors via the `variant` attribute:
  • **default** : Fixed position, non-toggleable.
  • **simple** : Support for toggling width (e.g., icon-only vs. full expanded view).
  • **overlay** : Overlays content when opened and supports swipe-to-close gestures.
    • ### Drag Interaction Use the `disableDrag` attribute/binding to disable swipe gestures on the **overlay** variant.

examples.name: sandbox-sidenav
examples.html:
Controls

Open/Close
@if (sidenavType() === 'overlay') {
Disable Drag
}
sidenav hello world

name: ShipCard
description:
### Variants

Card variants can be set using the
`variant`
attribute. Available options:
**type-a**
,
**type-b**
,
**type-c**
, and
**default**
.

### Toggle Card

Use
`<sh-toggle-card>`
for collapsible content. Use the
`disallowToggle`
attribute or binding to keep the card open.

name: ShipEventCard
description:
### Variants

Event card variants can be set using the
`variant`
attribute. Valid options are:
**simple**
,
**outlined**
,
**flat**
, and
**raised**
.

### Colors

Colors can be set using the
`color`
attribute. Valid options are:
**primary**
,
**accent**
,
**warn**
,
**error**
, and
**success**
.

:::info
This component utilizes the **Ship Sheet** utility for its visual structure. It supports standard sheet variations and is affected by global sheet variables.
:::

name: ShipFileUpload
description:
### Files Selected files are available via the `files` attribute. Use `[(files)]` for two-way binding. ### Selection Customize selection behavior:
  • `multiple` : Allows selecting more than one file.
  • `accept` : Restricts file types (e.g., `accept=".png,.jpg"` ).
    • ### Text Customize displayed labels:
  • `placeholder` : Text shown when empty.
  • `overlayText` : Text shown during drag-and-drop.

examples.name: base-file-upload
examples.html: <sh-file-upload [(files)]="files" accept=".json,.png" />

name: ShipProgressBar
description:
### Variants

Progress bar variants can be set using the
`variant`
attribute. Available variants:
**base**
,
**flat**
,
**outlined**
, and
**raised**
.

### Colors

Progress bar colors can be set using the
`color`
attribute. Available colors:
**primary**
,
**accent**
,
**warn**
,
**error**
, and
**success**
.

### Disabled

The progress bar can be disabled using the standard
`disabled`
attribute or
`[disabled]`
binding.

examples.name: flat-progress-bar
examples.html:
<sh-progress-bar variant="flat" [value]="10" />
<sh-progress-bar variant="flat" color="primary" [value]="25" />
<sh-progress-bar variant="flat" color="accent" [value]="50" />
<sh-progress-bar variant="flat" color="warn" [value]="75" />
<sh-progress-bar variant="flat" color="error" [value]="90" />
<sh-progress-bar variant="flat" color="success" [value]="100" />

<sh-progress-bar class="indeterminate" color="success" />

name: ShipSortable
description:
### Enable Sorting

Apply the
`shSortable`
directive to a
`sh-list`
or any container element to enable drag-and-drop reordering.

### Event Handling

Listen to the
`afterDrop`
event to update your data source when an item is moved:
`(afterDrop)="reorder($event)"`
.

### Handles

Add the
`sort-handle`
attribute to a specific element within a sortable item to limit dragging to that specific area.

examples.name: base-sortable
examples.html:
@for (todo of todos(); track $index) {
@if (todo.done) { {{ todo.title }} } @else { {{ todo.title }} }
}

name: GridSortable
description:
### Enable Sorting

Apply the
`shSortable`
directive to a
`sh-list`
or any container element to enable drag-and-drop reordering.

### Event Handling

Listen to the
`afterDrop`
event to update your data source when an item is moved:
`(afterDrop)="reorder($event)"`
.

### Handles

Add the
`sort-handle`
attribute to a specific element within a sortable item to limit dragging to that specific area.

examples.name: base-sortable
examples.html:
@for (todo of todos(); track $index) {
@if (todo.done) { {{ todo.title }} } @else { {{ todo.title }} }
}

name: ShipFormField
description:
### label

Optional label for the form field. Can include icons or other elements.

### prefix/suffix

Project content before or after the input using
`prefix`
or
`suffix`
slots.

### placeholder

Placeholder text for the input or textarea.

### boxPref/boxSuffix

Project content before or after the input but inside a box style
`boxPrefix`
or
`boxSuffix`
slots.

### hint

Optional hint text shown below the input.

### error

Optional error text shown below the input when in error state.

### disabled

Disables the input or textarea.

### size/class

Use
`small`
,
`autosize`
,
`center`
classes for different layouts.

examples.name: experimental-form-field
examples.html:
<section>
  <sh-form-field-experimental>
    <label>ReactiveFormsField: {{ reactiveFormValue() }}</label>
    <input placeholder="Placeholder no label..." type="text" [formControl]="reactiveFormControl" />
  </sh-form-field-experimental>

  <sh-form-field-experimental>
    <label>NgModel: {{ ngModelControl() }}</label>
    <input placeholder="Placeholder no label..." type="text" [(ngModel)]="ngModelControl" />
  </sh-form-field-experimental>
</section>

examples.name: base-form-field
examples.html:
Hello circle
hello 123

clock

name: ShipRangeSlider
description:
### Binding Two-way bindable value. Use `[(ngModel)]` or `[formControl]` . ### Constraints Set the range limits and increments using the `min` , `max` , and `step` attributes. ### Visuals Customize the look and feel:
  • `color` : **primary** , **accent** , **warn** , **success** , or **error** .
  • `variant` : **base** , **thick** , **outlined** , **flat** , or **raised** .
  • `sharp` : Use sharp corners instead of rounded.
  • `always-show` : Keep the value indicator visible at all times.
    • ### Unit Specify a suffix for the value display using the `unit` attribute (e.g., `unit="%"` ). ### Disabled The slider can be disabled using the standard `disabled` attribute or `[disabled]` binding.

examples.name: base-range-slider
examples.html: Selected: {{ value() }}

examples.name: disabled-range-slider
examples.html: Selected: {{ value() }}

examples.name: range-slider-sandbox
examples.html:
Disabled Read-only @if (variation() !== 'thick') { Always show value indicator } Sharp

Selected: {{ value() }}

examples.html: Selected: {{ value() }}

examples.name: readonly-range-slider
examples.html: Selected: {{ value() }}

examples.name: float-range-slider

examples.name: reactive-range-slider
examples.html: Selected: {{ control.value }}

examples.name: unit-range-slider
examples.html: Selected: {{ value() }}%

name: ShipResize
description:
### Data & Loading

Provide data via
`[data]`
and toggle a loading state using the
`loading`
attribute.

### Sorting

Enable sorting by applying
`shSort`
to header cells. Track the active column with
`sortByColumn`
(two-way bindable).

### Resizing

Apply the
`shResize`
directive to header cells to allow column width adjustment. Available inputs:
`resizable`
,
`minWidth`
, and
`maxWidth`
.

### Sticky Columns

Use the
`shStickyColumns`
attribute (
**start**
or
**end**
) or apply
`.sticky`
/
`.sticky-end`
classes to header cells to pin columns.

### Column Sizing

Use the
`size`
attribute on
`<th>`
elements to set initial or fixed widths (e.g.,
`size="1fr"`
,
`size="200px"`
).

examples.name: resizing-table
examples.html:
@for (col of displayedColumns(); track col) { {{ col }} } @for (row of dataSource(); track $index) { @for (col of displayedColumns(); track col) { {{ row[col] }} } }
No data available

examples.ts:
import { ChangeDetectionStrategy, Component, input, signal } from '@angular/core';
import { ShipStickyColumns, ShipTable, ShipTableVariant } from 'ship-ui';

const ELEMENT_DATA = [
  { position: 1, name: 'Hydrogen', weight: 1.0079, symbol: 'H' },
  { position: 2, name: 'Helium', weight: 4.0026, symbol: 'He' },
  { position: 3, name: 'Lithium', weight: 6.941, symbol: 'Li' },

  { position: 7, name: 'Nitrogen', weight: 14.0067, symbol: 'N' },
  { position: 8, name: 'Oxygen', weight: 15.9994, symbol: 'O' },
  { position: 9, name: 'Fluorine', weight: 18.9984, symbol: 'F' },
  { position: 10, name: 'Neon', weight: 20.1797, symbol: 'Ne' },

  { position: 2, name: 'Helium', weight: 4.0026, symbol: 'He' },
  { position: 3, name: 'Lithium', weight: 6.941, symbol: 'Li' },

  { position: 2, name: 'Helium', weight: 4.0026, symbol: 'He' },
  { position: 3, name: 'Lithium', weight: 6.941, symbol: 'Li' },
  { position: 4, name: 'Beryllium', weight: 9.0122, symbol: 'Be' },
  { position: 5, name: 'Boron', weight: 10.811, symbol: 'B' },

  { position: 9, name: 'Fluorine', weight: 18.9984, symbol: 'F' },
  { position: 10, name: 'Neon', weight: 20.1797, symbol: 'Ne' },
];
const COLUMNS = ['position', 'name', 'weight', 'symbol'] as const;

@Component({
  selector: 'multi-sticky-table',
  standalone: true,
  imports: [ShipTable, ShipStickyColumns],
  templateUrl: './multi-sticky-table.html',
  styleUrl: './multi-sticky-table.scss',
  changeDetection: ChangeDetectionStrategy.OnPush,
})
export class MultiStickyTable {
  variant = input<ShipTableVariant | null>(null);
  displayedColumns = signal([...COLUMNS]);
  dataSource = signal([...ELEMENT_DATA]);
  sortByColumn = signal<string | null>(null);
  isLoading = signal(false);
}

name: ShipSpinner
description:
### Size & Thickness

Customize the spinner appearance using CSS variables:
`--spinner-size`
and
`--spinner-thickness`
.

### Colors

Spinner colors can be set using the
`color`
attribute. Valid options are:
**primary**
,
**accent**
,
**warn**
,
**error**
, and
**success**
.

examples.name: sandbox-spinner

name: ShipStepper
description:
### Colors

Stepper colors can be set using the
`color`
attribute. Available options are:
**primary**
,
**accent**
,
**warn**
,
**error**
, and
**success**
.

@if (_activeStep === 0) {
Step 1 Content
} @else if (_activeStep === 1) {
Step 2 Content
} @else if (_activeStep === 2) {
Step 3 Content
}

@let _activeStep = activeStep();
@if (_activeStep === 0) {

} @else if (_activeStep === 1) {

} @else if (_activeStep === 2) {
Step 3 Content
}

name: ShipChip
description:
### Variants

Chip variants can be set using the
`variant`
attribute. Valid options are:
**simple**
,
**outlined**
,
**flat**
, and
**raised**
.

### Sizes

Chip sizes can be set using the
`size`
attribute. For example:
`size="small"`
.

### Colors

Chip colors can be set using the
`color`
attribute. Valid options are:
**primary**
,
**accent**
,
**warn**
,
**error**
, and
**success**
.

### Dynamic Coloring

You can set a custom color using the CSS variable
`--chip-c`
together with the
`dynamic`
input (as an attribute or binding). This is ideal for tagging purposes where you need a wide range of colors.

### Icons

Chips can contain icons using the
`sh-icon`
component. Use the
`suffix`
attribute for trailing icons.

### Readonly

The chip can be set to readonly through the
`readonly`
input (adds the
`readonly`
class).

### Disabled

The chip can be disabled using the standard
`disabled`
attribute or
`[disabled]`
binding.

:::info
This component utilizes the **Ship Sheet** utility for its visual structure. It supports standard sheet variations and is affected by global sheet variables.
:::

examples.name: base-chip
examples.html:
<sh-chip>
  <sh-icon>circle</sh-icon>
</sh-chip>

<sh-chip>
  <sh-icon>circle</sh-icon>
  Basic
  <sh-icon suffix>circle</sh-icon>
</sh-chip>

<sh-chip color="primary">
  <sh-icon>circle</sh-icon>
  Primary
  <sh-icon suffix>circle</sh-icon>
</sh-chip>

<sh-chip color="accent">
  <sh-icon>circle</sh-icon>
  Accent
  <sh-icon suffix>circle</sh-icon>
</sh-chip>

<sh-chip color="warn">
  <sh-icon>circle</sh-icon>
  Warn
  <sh-icon suffix>circle</sh-icon>
</sh-chip>

<sh-chip color="error">

  <sh-icon suffix>circle</sh-icon>
</sh-chip>

<sh-chip color="success">
  <sh-icon>circle</sh-icon>
  Success
  <sh-icon suffix>circle</sh-icon>
</sh-chip>

<sh-chip disabled>

  Disabled
  <sh-icon suffix>circle</sh-icon>
</sh-chip>

name: ShipList
description:
### item

Add the
`item`
attribute to a child element of
`sh-list`
to make it a list item.

### action

Add the
`action`
attribute to a child element of
`sh-list`
to make it an actionable item (e.g., clickable).

### suffix

Add the
`suffix`
attribute to an element inside a list item to align it to the right.

examples.name: base-list-example
examples.html:
Basic

circle Simple item O
circle Another simple item O
circle Actionable item O
circle Checkbox item with reactive form control
Checkbox item with ngModel

name: ShipMenu
description:
### Searchable Enable a wildcard search input to filter menu options using the `searchable` attribute. ### Behavior Customize menu interaction:
  • `asMultiLayer` : Enables nested menu support.
  • `closeOnClick` : Determines if the menu closes when an option is selected (default: true).
  • `disabled` : Disables the menu trigger and content.
    • ### Slots Add a `suffix` attribute to an element inside a menu option to display hotkeys, icons, or secondary information at the trailing end.

examples.name: icon-suffix-menu
examples.html: @for (item of menuItems; track item.value) { }

examples.name: search-menu-example
examples.html: @for (item of filteredItems; track item.value) { }

examples.name: multi-layer-menu-example
examples.html:
<sh-menu [asMultiLayer]="true">
  <button shButton class="outlined">Open multi-layer menu</button>
  <ng-container menu>
    @for (item of menu; track $index) {
      @if (item.children) {
        <sh-menu [asMultiLayer]="true">
          <button>{{ item.label }}</button>
          <ng-container menu>
            @for (sub of item.children; track sub.value) {
              <button (click)="select(sub)" [class.selected]="selected === sub.value">
                {{ sub.label }}
              </button>
            }
          </ng-container>
        </sh-menu>
      } @else {
        <button (click)="select(item)" [class.selected]="selected === item.value">
          {{ item.label }}
        </button>
      }
    }
  </ng-container>
</sh-menu>

examples.name: toggle-select-menu-example
examples.html:
<sh-menu>
  <button shButton class="outlined">Open toggle select menu</button>
  <ng-container menu>
    @for (item of menuItems; track item.value) {
      <button (click)="toggle($event, item)">
        <sh-checkbox [class.active]="isSelected(item)" class="primary raised">
          {{ item.label }}
        </sh-checkbox>
      </button>
    }
  </ng-container>
</sh-menu>

examples.name: base-menu-example
examples.html:
<sh-menu>
  <button shButton class="outlined">Open menu</button>
  <ng-container menu>
    @for (item of menuItems; track item.value) {
      <button (click)="someFunction(item)">
        {{ item.label }}
      </button>
    }
  </ng-container>
</sh-menu>

name: ShipDatepickerInput
description:
### Selection Selected values are available via `date` and `endDate` . Use `[(date)]` and `[(endDate)]` for two-way binding. ### Configuration Customize the picker behavior:
  • `asRange` : Enable range selection mode.
  • `monthsToShow` : Set the number of months displayed (default: 1).
  • `startOfWeek` : Specify the first day of the week (0-6).
  • `weekdayLabels` : Provide custom labels for week days.
    • ### Input Display Customize how dates appear in inputs:
  • `masking` : Set the date format mask (e.g., `'mediumDate'` ).
  • `size` : Use the `small` attribute/class for a compact input.
    • ### Interaction
  • `closed` : Event emitted when the picker is dismissed.
  • `disabled` : Standard attribute to disable interaction.

examples.name: input-datepicker-ngmodel
examples.html:
clock

Selected: {{ date() | date: 'medium' }}

examples.name: datepicker-sandbox

Disabled Sharp

Selected date: {{ date() | date: 'mediumDate' }}

examples.html:

End: {{ endDate() ? (endDate() | date: 'mediumDate') : 'None' }}

examples.html:

Start: {{ startDate.value | date: 'mediumDate' }}

End: {{ endDate.value | date: 'mediumDate' }}

name: ShipButtonGroup
description:
### Variants

Button groups support different layouts via the
`variant`
attribute. Valid options:
**default**
and
**type-b**
.

### Sizes

Use the
`size`
attribute to change the scale of the group, e.g.,
`size="small"`
.

### Active State

Apply the
`active`
attribute or class to a button within the group to highlight it as the current selection.

examples.name: base-button-group
examples.html:
<sh-button-group [class.small]="small()" [class]="type()">
  @for (item of items(); track $index) {
    <button [class.active]="activeIndex() === $index" (click)="updateActiveIndex($index)">
      <sh-icon>circle</sh-icon>
      Hello
    </button>
  }
</sh-button-group>

name: ShipPopover
description:
### Hover Trigger

Use the
`onHover`
attribute or binding to open the popover on hover instead of click.

### Nesting

Use the
`asMultiLayer`
attribute to enable nested popover support.

### Customization

The
`options`
attribute accepts a configuration object with:
`width`
,
`height`
,
`closeOnButton`
, and
`closeOnEsc`
.

examples.name: sh-button-popover
examples.html: hello im a shButton trigger hello im content

examples.name: trigger-attribute-popover
examples.html:
hello im a div trigger
hello im content

examples.name: button-popover
examples.html:
<sh-popover>
  <button>hello im a trigger plain button trigger</button>
  hello im content
</sh-popover>

name: ShipButton
description:
### Variants

Button variants can be set using the
`variant`
attribute. Valid options are:
**simple**
,
**outlined**
,
**flat**
, and
**raised**
.

### Sizes

Button sizes can be set using the
`size`
attribute. For example:
`size="small"`
.

### Colors

Button colors can be set using the
`color`
attribute. Valid options are:
**primary**
,
**accent**
,
**warn**
,
**error**
, and
**success**
.

### Loading

The button can be set to loading state by adding the
`loading`
class.

### Readonly

The button can be set to readonly through the
`readonly`
input (adds the
`readonly`
class) or the standard
`readonly`
attribute.

### Rotate icon

Icons within the button can be rotated by adding the
`rotated-icon`
class.

### Disabled

The button can be disabled using the standard
`disabled`
attribute or
`[disabled]`
binding.

:::info
This component utilizes the **Ship Sheet** utility for its visual structure. It supports standard sheet variations and is affected by global sheet variables.
:::

name: ShipDivider
description:
### Orientation

Use the
`<sh-divider>`
element to visually separate sections. By default, it is horizontal.

### Content

You can place text or icons inside the divider tags to create a divider with integrated content:
`<sh-divider>OR</sh-divider>`
.

Above the divider
Below the divider

RGB: {{ currentColor()?.rgb }}

HEX: {{ currentColor()?.hex }}

Hue: {{ currentColor()?.hue }}

name: ShipDialog
description:
### Customization

The
`options`
attribute accepts a configuration object for:
`width`
,
`height`
,
`maxWidth`
,
`maxHeight`
,
`closeOnButton`
,
`closeOnEsc`
, and
`closeOnOutsideClick`
.

### Variants

Dialogs support multiple layouts via the
`variant`
attribute. Valid options:
**default**
and
**type-b**
.

### Slots

Structure your dialog content using the
`header`
,
`content`
, and
`footer`
attributes on container elements.

examples.name: basic-dynamic-dialog
examples.html: <button shButton (click)="openDialog()">Open Basic Dialog</button>

examples.name: dialog-as-component
examples.html:
<button shButton (click)="openDialog()" [class.type]="type()">Open dialog as component</button>

<sh-dialog [(isOpen)]="isOpen" (closed)="close()">hello im dialog content</sh-dialog>

examples.name: data-passing-dialog
examples.html: <button shButton (click)="openDialog()">Open Data Passing hi Dialog</button>

examples.name: header-footer-dialog
examples.html: <button shButton (click)="openDialog()">Open Header/Footer Dialog</button>

name: ShipToggle
description:
### Variants

Toggle variants can be set using the
`variant`
attribute. Valid options are:
**simple**
,
**outlined**
,
**flat**
, and
**raised**
.

### Colors

Toggle colors can be set using the
`color`
attribute. Valid options are:
**primary**
,
**accent**
,
**warn**
,
**error**
, and
**success**
.

### Readonly

The toggle can be set to readonly through the
`readonly`
input (adds the
`readonly`
class).

### Disabled

The toggle can be disabled using the standard
`disabled`
attribute or
`[disabled]`
binding.

examples.name: simple-toggle
examples.html:
<sh-toggle [class.active]="active()" (click)="active.set(!active())" variant="simple" />
<sh-toggle [class.active]="active()" (click)="active.set(!active())" variant="simple" color="primary" />
<sh-toggle [class.active]="active()" (click)="active.set(!active())" variant="simple" color="accent" />
<sh-toggle [class.active]="active()" (click)="active.set(!active())" variant="simple" color="warn" />
<sh-toggle [class.active]="active()" (click)="active.set(!active())" variant="simple" color="error" />
<sh-toggle [class.active]="active()" (click)="active.set(!active())" variant="simple" color="success" />
<sh-toggle [class.active]="active()" (click)="active.set(!active())" variant="simple" disabled />

examples.name: raised-toggle
examples.html:
<sh-toggle [class.active]="active()" (click)="active.set(!active())" variant="raised" />

name: ShipCheckbox
description:
:::info
This component utilizes the **Ship Sheet** utility for its visual structure. It supports standard sheet variations and is affected by global sheet variables.
:::

name: ShipRadio
description:
:::info
This component utilizes the **Ship Sheet** utility for its visual structure. It supports standard sheet variations and is affected by global sheet variables.
:::

name: ShipIcon
description:
### Sizes Icons can be set to different sizes using the `size` attribute. Valid options are: **small** , **large** , or **inherit** . ### Colors Icon colors can be set using the `color` attribute. Valid options are: **primary** , **accent** , **warn** , **error** , and **success** . Color can also be overridden with CSS color variables: `{{ `\cloud-warning\` }}` ### Icon Packs Currently we support Phosphor Icons. Search for icons here: Search Phosphor Icons arrow-square-out We support multiple weight variations using ligatures:
  • `cloud-warning` (Regular - default)
    • - `cloud-warning-thin` - `cloud-warning-light` - `cloud-warning-fill` - `cloud-warning-bold` ### Icon CLI Use our CLI tool to generate optimized icon fonts containing only the icons you use. Generate once: `ship-fg --src='./src' --out='./src/assets' --rootPath='./'` Watch mode: `ship-fg --src='./src' --out='./src/assets' --rootPath='./' --watch`

examples.name: sandbox-icon
examples.html:
Controls

@if (size() === 'inherit') {
}

Cloud-warning

cloud-warning cloud-warning-thin cloud-warning-light cloud-warning-fill cloud-warning-bold

Warning

warning warning-thin warning-light warning-fill warning-bold

Warning warning-octagon

warning-octagon warning-octagon-thin warning-octagon-light warning-octagon-fill warning-octagon-bold

name: ShipSelect
description:
### Options Provide the data source using the `options` attribute. This can be an array of strings or objects. ### Labels & Values If your options are objects, specify which properties to use for display and selection:
  • `label` : Property path to the display text (e.g., `"user.name"` ).
  • `value` : Property path to the selection value (e.g., `"user.id"` ).
    • ### Selection Modes Toggle selection behavior:
  • `selectMultiple` : Enables picking multiple options.
  • `isClearable` : Adds a clear button to remove the selection (default: true).
    • ### Interaction
  • `inlineSearch` : Adds a search field within the dropdown to filter options.
  • `readonly` : Prevents selection changes while maintaining focusability.
  • `disabled` : Standard attribute to disable the component.
    • ### Templates Customize rendering using `ng-template` :
  • `optionTemplate` : Custom rendering for items in the dropdown.
  • `placeholderTemplate` : Custom rendering for the selected state/placeholder.

name: GlobalVariables
description: Global CSS variables for ShipUI including colors, typography, and spacing.

name: SheetVariables
description: Common CSS variables for components using the "sh-sheet" class. These variables control background, border, and color scales for different variants.
